alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 3:25PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY CONTINUES FOR AREAS SOUTH OF SELIGMAN UNTIL 530 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas south of Seligman and west of Picacho Butte in northern Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 530 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pine Creek, Big Chino Wash, Turkey Canyon and Partridge Creek. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
